alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 5:34AM EST until December 28 at 7:49PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pasture land north of the river, downstream of the gage, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Thursday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 07/10/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
